title: i want mana costs to matter again
body:
mana management should be a skill

the way most of these new and reworked champs operate they might as well be manaless

why royeeet

replies.body: I remember when I ran out of mana in lane... Ahhh the good days. Lulu was a champion, but so was Kassadin.

I remember when people were bad at this game and now they're decent and know how to manage mana properly. There are no champions with cheap as dirt mana costs and if you're spamming your abilities all the time, you will run out of mana pretty fast.

Since there is a practice mode (on PBE?), i suggest you take your pick(s) and try it.
Find us a champion that can do what he wants without worrying about his resource management.

You do realize mana management only existed because most of the league roster had point and click spells with relatively short cooldowns. They had to be gated (eg Pantheon, even Kalista if she didn't have the mana refund)

Now that most champions are skillshot reliant or require conditions to do maximum damage and can be outplayed, mana costs have come down to be less punishing.

No, one of the last changes to Orianna was in the form of a mana buff for attack move and ult. 

Command Attack
Cost reduced to 30 / 35 / 40 / 45 / 50 from 50 at all ranks

Also ult is now 100 at all ranks (this made sense).

Champions are being designed around the fact that they need their abilities to function as champions. Darius has the lowest attack speed of all Juggernauts (and possibly anyone, not sure), so he is required around that fact to use Q for the forefront of all his damage. Thing is, simply by being in Melee range, Darius loses 65% of his damage from Q, and no stacks. Since Juggernauts weakness are to be kited, which is rather easy with a good team, they get more leniency  with their mana costs. Same rule applies to other Jugs (save Illaoi, them mana costs on E, and how much you wanna use Q)

Mages who actually use Mana as a stat, and itemize it, are much more likely to run Oom in lane, before they literally buy an item to make that less of a concern, because that's their shtick. Fighters don't commonly itemize Mana, save Triforce's, and I suppose that is meant to be a pro for the whole Melee v. Range concern, but that's another topic for another day. Fiora relies heavily on her dashes to work her way around to hit those Vitals, and as such, needs to have that ability up. A Fiora who couldn't use her Dash would lose to every other champion, as her survivability and damage is based around dashing. 

ADC's are variant in their use of Mana when it comes to it. Lucian requires an Essence Reaver for his build, as he actually does run out of mana rather fast mid game, because his entire damage output relies on chaining his spells. Jhin on the other hand, doesn't rely on his abilities for the front of his damage, and as a result, his abilities are lower cost because they aren't nessecary, but helpful when it comes to his kit. Sure, Jhin still builds ER, but that's just because it gives CDR with AD and Crit Chance if anything is to be seen from that.
